game

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jbox2d.callbacks.ContactListener

    public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.jbox2d.callbacks.ContactListener
    GameController manages gameplay by keeping track of keyboard and mouse input as well as recognizing and driving game state changes.
    Since:
    2015-04-24
    Version:
    2015-04-28
    Author:
    Spencer Davis, Josh Kepros, Josh McDermott, Chris Swanson

      void beginContact(org.jbox2d.dynamics.contacts.Contact contact)

        public void pauseGame()
        PauseGame used to pause the current game.

      • exitGame

        public void exitGame()
        ExitGame used to change game state to inactive and then exit.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        EndGame method used when game has ended. Waits WINDELAY milliseconds before calling exitGame().

      • beginContact

        public void beginContact(org.jbox2d.dynamics.contacts.Contact contact)
        Used to receive input on contact between two JBox2D Fixtures, and by extension the Entities that hold them. Calls .hit() on the Entities involved.
        Specified by:
        beginContact in interface org.jbox2d.callbacks.ContactListener
        Parameters:
        contact -
        See Also:
        ContactListener

      • endContact

        public void endContact(org.jbox2d.dynamics.contacts.Contact contact)
        Required by the ContactListener interface, but unused in this instance. Would be used if we had something that needed to occur when two entities stopped being in contact with each other.
        Specified by:
        endContact in interface org.jbox2d.callbacks.ContactListener
        Parameters:
        contact -
